cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 395 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Drifting northward, then turning north-northeast and accelerating toward the northeast.  Forecast track takes the center across the Florida Big Bend Thursday, into Georgia/Carolinas Friday, and offshore of the Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts this weekend.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: northwest Florida coast between Anclote River and Indian Pass

weather_observation.watch_coast: Marineland Florida to Altamaha Sound Georgia (Tropical Storm Watch); Anclote River to Indian Pass (Hurricane Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Anclote River to Walton/Bay County line, FL (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf coast of Florida, then Atlantic coasts of Georgia, the Carolinas, and eventually the Mid-Atlantic and southern New England coasts
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (â‰¤10%) of tropical-storm-force winds late Saturday night into Sunday; breezy conditions expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate to locally heavy rain possible Sunday as the system passes offshore, but totals likely below 4 inches.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, rip currents and minor coastal flooding possible along New Jersey and Delaware beaches which could disrupt vessel pilotage and harbor operations.
